data.title: Please don't update so quickly
data.body: RA2 mod needs time to follow your guys update,

data.title: Source won't compile
data.body:
I've been following the guide at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Compiling

The solution won't compile.  I get a errors like: "OpenRA\source\OpenRA.Game\Actor.cs(16,7,16,13): error CS0246: The type or namespace name 'Eluant' could not be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)"

I'm thinking these compile errors are because the right dependencies aren't copied?  I wasn't able to do the make properly.  When I go to the command prompt and run "make.cmd dependencies" I just get the message " 'powershell' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.

data.title: Reduce "nearEnough" leniency for regular move orders

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
Units give up if their path is blocked while they're `nearEnough`. 
8 cells is far more lenient than necessary though, halving that to 4 should improve behaviour enough until we have a better fix for this.

This should at least reduce #12395 and #5968 quite a bit.

Some related discussion can be found in #11440.

data.title: Add a proper man page for openra-server
data.body:
The current man page of `openra` that is generated by `OpenRA.Utility.exe all --man-page` does not cover all the options and if it would they are exposed in-game anyway, while on the other hand there is no decent man page for `openra-server`.  Rewrite the `--man-page` option to generate a man page for `openra-server` and create a static one for `openra`.

See also the discussion in PR #12524.

data.title: Debian packaging lintian clean
data.body: This PR patches up the Debian/Ubuntu packaging as to be valid with respect to the latest Debian packaging standards by means of manual inspection/review (as a Debian developer) and the lintian tool.

data.title: "Restart" option during a replay causes crash
data.body: When I watch a replay and pause it + press "leave" I see the "restart" option. This causes the game to crash for me. But also probably it shouldnt be there (unless it means 'restart the replay', but if Im correct its a leftover from the normal menu when playing a mission/skirmish?).

data.title: Ideas: Map Editor Features:
data.body:
**Ideas/Wishlist**

**Tile selection information**
Ability to select a group of cells and have the editor display dimensions in length and width and the amount of resources that are in those cells.

**A mirroring tool**
Highlighting a cell lists its a corresponding cell both the the map we're mirrored both vertically or horizontally.

**Build/Weapon radius display**
A build radius should be displayed when an conyard, defencive structure, etc are placed.

**Passable/impassable tile overlay**
Simple red/green see through over lay showing which tiles cannot be occupied (because of trees, other units, debris, etc)

**Ability to highlight and move cells - replacing them with blank terrain.**

**Ability to do a mirror/reverse of all selected items(tiles, actors, etc), both horizontally and vertically**

**Actual copy/paste clipboard, allowing other things to be adjusted before pasting. Instead of current system which is essentially a drag and drop copy.**

**An undo/redo feature**

**Change Map Property Interface**
add weather effects
change size
change tileset (snow, desert, etc)
change mod (will create a host of issues, but have some thoughts on how these can be solved)

**Tile editor - Ability to edit which tiles are passable.**
Fix road tiles that include a debris cell, etc.

**Tile art editor**
Simple image editor
I'm still on the fence about this one - I want some new tiles, and to change a few existing ones, but don't want to open the door to complete trash. Perhaps simply expanding the official tile-set is a better option - would like to hear thoughts on this.

**Ability to change whether a tile is passable or not**
Fix bad road tiles that have a unpassable debris cell in them.
Stop crates dropping in unwanted areas
Simplify mini map for players
balance maps easily
Fix weird cliff tiles that don't conform to 2x2 tiles

**Yaml editor**
Change unit values such as
weapon equipped
health
damage
veterancy
garrison-able/or not
etc etc

data.title: (Map?) Yaml merging broken (at least for map-specific weapon yamls)
data.body:
Using #12512 as testcase I tried negating the `Image` of RA's 90mm and 105mm, neither `-Image:` nor `Image:` worked.

Tried the same on RA shellmap as well to make sure it's not map-specific, same result, image still shows.

data.title: Add some performance-friendly TS maps

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
Most of our currently included TS maps are closer to worst-case in terms of cliffs, bridges/water and size.

We should focus on the following smaller maps next.

FS:
- [x] Tiers of Sorrow (2): Very small, no water, no tunnels. #13941
- [ ] They All Float (2): Quite small and no relevant water. WIP [ts-float](https://github.com/Mailaender/OpenRA/tree/ts-float)
- [ ] Dueling Islands (2): Small 2-player map, water should actually help performance once bridges/domains work better (due to lots of cells the pathfinder doesn't need to consider for most actors).

TS:
- [ ] Limited Access (4): Despite the name, performance should be ok due to medium size, max 4 players <s>and no bridges</s>. #14034
- [ ] Pit or Plateau (4): Similar reasoning to Limited Access.

data.title: Utility application crash when creating hash
data.body: The OpenRA utility is crashing for some maps in the resource center when trying to create a hash for them, resulting in the hash "Error: Utility application crashed. See utility.log for details". This also prevents uploading another map that results in the same error as it recognises them as the same map. I don't know what would be causing such an error.

data.title: Slim down D2k weapon yamls
data.body:
This downsizes the weapon yaml files and makes it a bit easier to apply wider-scale changes like #12513 later.

With regard to missile commit: `^Rocket` = small + unguided, `^Missile` = larger + guided.

data.title: Some minor TD weapon yamls restructuring
data.body: Saving a few more yaml lines and increasing the use of inheritance a bit more, to make potential future across-the-board changes easier.

data.title: Add an OpenSequence to the ParaBombs in Survival02
data.body:
Fixes #12362. Hopefully once and for all, this was a constant annoyance as it broke every second release because something changed the way yaml merging works. We could also remove the entire custom image instead (which might look even better).

Note that this only hides a yaml merger bug, but as stated above, I'd like to just get rid of this one special case (as this is iirc already the third PR with a fix for that problem).

data.title: Fix a potential crash in Monster Tank Madness
data.body: To prevent crashes like http://pastebin.com/vgWQ9TRW . They are quite hard to reproduce though. You need to crush a sandbag wall right in the one second delay (we could also try to reduce the delay or use an `OnAddedToWorld` trigger for when the actor is added back after changing its ownership).

data.title: Desert Bridge Water Sections sometimes don't fully repair
data.body:
Noticed this when playing on a map and tried to correct the issue and it seems if there's enough water sections like in this case: http://i.imgur.com/7xuqEvK.png it might just be the choice of tiles.

Also here's the original map I found this happening. http://resource.openra.net/maps/17878/#comments

This only seems to happen with the water sections placed by the map editor that cause this.

data.title: A speed between normal and faster: "Brisk" or "Fast-ish"
data.body:
Call it "Brisk" or something similar. Speed choices are great, but the current choices are essentially "slow, but i can micro", "too fast for micro" and "unplayable" (not taking into account lagging games). 

The goal would be to make "Brisk" play at the fastest speed where you can still micro (albeit with increased effort).

A speed between normal and faster would be great for a few things, IMO. 

**League matches:** I believe currently the RAGL rules allow the home player to choose normal or faster when playing their "home game", however, no-one chooses faster - likely cause of the fact its VERY hard to micro at all. a "Brisk" speed would allow a macro player to take back some of the micro advantage from a good micro player and help mix things up a bit by using game speed as a part of your tactic to beat another player.

**Streaming:** SoScared has used faster in the past when unknown players play on stream. This has been to ensure games get into the action quicker and are finished quicker (in case the players are terrible and or uninteresting to watch). It's essentially a very sensible choice for a streamer, but not fair to the players. Brisk may be a happy medium and a good solution to this.

**Time poor casual players:** We all have lives and jobs, between which we try to play as much OpenRA as possible. If "Brisk" becomes a reality, maybe i can fit another game into the time i have available to play that evening - while still retaining the core experience.

**Anti Lag for 1v1 games:** When playing people with suspicious latency, Brisk might be a good way to get an anti lag effect without game-breaking speed if the game does not lag (as opposed to using faster for this purpose).

**Tool for practicing your micro:** If you can learn to micro whilst on Brisk, you should see your normal speed game micro abilities improve!

I'm not sure how to express exactly how much faster I'm talking about, but I will put it in the following terms: At normal speed a nuke takes 9 mins to charge, on faster it takes 6:45. Brisk should be around 7:45-8mins to charge a nuke.

data.title: Added Tiberian Sun map Forest Fires
data.body:
This already imported fine since https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/11441 http://resource.openra.net/maps/15973/ but with added demolition and repair https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/12430 it is even more playable.

Reference: http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Forest_Fires

data.title: TD Balance Changes 12242016.
data.body:
Add detection to temple of Nod.
(Nice to have detection then stealthers sneaking by it)

artillery minimum range increase from 2c896 to 3c0.

mammoth tank HP increase from 800 to 870.
(Dies by medium tank spams and e3 a little to easily from recent changes. With a longer build time they fall prey to mass numbers.)

ion time increase from 3:00 to 4:30.
(Ion strikes go off a little to fast. Mammoth armies take about 2:00 to build back up. By the time base attacks happen close to 3:00)

nuke timer from 5 to 6.
(Because the nuke damage has been buffed)

nuke damage spread from 2c512 to 5c512.
(Nuke damage spread was to weak. Barely killing a power plant where it lands just a few cells away from base hit)

nuke spread damage increased from 100 to 110. (First spread modifier)
(See line above)

a10 timer increased from 3:30 to 4:00.
(Timer increased because they were going off a little to fast still. These planes kill infantry builds as it is.)

MSAM HP from 120 to 180.
(To weak vs air. Missiles drain takes a few seconds to reload and then sniped within that time. Specially since dedicated AA)

Commando weapon range increased from 6c0 to 8c0.
(They had the same range as e3 and minigunners were able to close distances on them extremely fast. Take note they shoot farther then their vision range.)

Commando weapon projectile speed increased from 1c682 to 5c682.
(This was super annoying. You fire a shot and the infantry doesn't die because bullet travel to slow. Increased this fixed the problem.)

Commando price increase from 1000 to 2000.
(Extremely cheap when buffed. Increased price to match their power.)

Commando build time increased from 24 to 32. (2000 Build duration)
(Build time a little to fast. Compensates this with multiple barracks.)

Husks interval timer increased from 2 to 6.
(Husks blow up to fast to capture anything. Kept on low timer to prevent vehicle block. Only possible way is to have an engineer in an APC ready. Which Nod is unable to have APCs.)

Bike damage increase from 30 to 31.
(HP changes on harvs, structures, and mammoth. A very small change leading to a decent buff. Granting a 2 damage increase with constant hits)

Chem damage vs none reduced from 100 to 70.
(Chems performing a little to well by themselves. Having mixed units is a better solution. IE: My recent flame tank chem trooper mix)

Chem damage vs armor increased from 50 to 75.
(Chems performed a little to weak vs armor. Doing less damage then infantry and getting squashed by medium tanks and light tanks. This will make players think twice about squashing tactics. Also more damage vs armored defenses.)

Grenadier accuracy reduced from 213 to 813. (Makes them miss a lot more).
(Grenadiers were to accurate and unable to kill infantry packs. Looking at CNC95 and RA in ORA they miss their targets as well. Having them miss spreads their AoE damage and able to take out infantry packs. Players maye want to think of spreading infantry when fighting grenadiers)

Flamer damage vs armor reduced from 20 to 10. (Flame infantry)
(To much damage to APCs and light tanks)

Flamer damage vs none increased from 100 to 110. (Flame infantry.)
(Made them stronger vs infantry to balance out vs chems. Makes them a strong viable choice.)

Harv build timer increase from 24 to 27. (1680 build timer)
(Harv spamming is like a disease. Its gotten to strong to quickly. Increasing their timer slightly also increases other viable builds.)

Harvester HP increase from 600 to 625.
(Both medium tanks and bikes doing a little to much damage. Compensates slightly for build timer)

Refinery power reduced from 50 to 40.
(Offers more build choices. Opening barracks becomes stronger then going strip/factory all the time. Both openings strong strats just requires scouting.)

Refinery sell no longer refunds.
(Includes with the harv spamming. Gave 250 back which counted towards buggy/bike money. IE: PP > Ref > Strip (Strip makes 2-3 buggies 2 bikes then a harv) > Ref (Sell ref gain harv) > Strip (Because power only 30) > PP

Refinery tiberium hold reduced from 2000 to 700.
(This has had no impact to force people to build silos. But it opts people to protect refineries rather then "Lost a ref. Meh. Got 3 others.". Losing a ref now loses earned money. If it holds money. Also prevents sell trick to save power.)

Silo hold increase from 2000 to 3000.
(Compensate for Refinery. Also has extra HP now. See below.)

AGT HP from 600 to 550.
(Way to strong when it came to units coming to these in mass amounts. Also hard for artillery units to shell due to small box size and HP pool.)

Light Tank price reduced from 700 to 650.
(700 was a bit to high. 650 seems to hit the right spot but left build time as is. 0:17)

Visceroid spawn reduce from 10 to 5.
(This was a weird one. Infantry dieing in tiberium was at a good spot. But for some reason when chems kill infantry it would create 2-3 visceroids. Then those visceroids would create 2-3 at a time. RNG issue so was reduced.)

Increase all building HP by 100.
(Help balance vs medium tanks, bikes, light tanks, chems, grenadiers, air units, and stealth tanks.)

Gun turret HP increase from 400 to 410.
(This is taking baby steps. I want them a little tougher vs medium tanks but not at the point of RA style. Same logic as obrakmann taking baby steps with MCV.)

Starting units adjusted.
(This created a big problem in competitive scenes. Having early units is good to prevent infantry rushes. But starting with a bike/apc while your opponent starts with a hummer/buggy is to off balancing.)

MCV build time decreased from 1:36 to 1:00. (3750)
(Price unchanged. Takes a little to long in team games and some 1v1 scenarios to get one built. Also now drains money faster to compensate)

Engineer HP increase from 25 to 30.
(Dies a little to quick hummers/buggies. Same kill time as minigunner (If takes a hit while standing)

APC HP increase from 210 to 215.
(These are dieing a little to fast and weak vs certian units. IE: buggies/hummers and bikes. Tested vs light tanks and more optimal. Baby steps.)

APC Damage vs light decreased from 105 to 100.
(I don't want them killing bikes to fast now that they are cheaper.)

APC cost decreased from 600 to 550.
(APCs for infantry builds as GDI was waaaaay to expensive. Having a slightly faster build timer of 0:14 instead of 0:15 will help too. Helps to withstand early onslaught of Nod. Keep note bikes still 0:12 timer)

(Created new Sam weapon Dragon from RA e3 AA. Reason: Shared weapon with AGT.)

Samsite range increased from 8c0 to 12c0.
(Dedicated AA. Keep note: Longer range = longer time to kill a unit and able to escape. Closer it is the faster air units die.)

Samsite spread damage decreased from 682 to 128.
(To much AoE damage)

Samsite range limit increased from 9c614 to 15co.
(Missiles would die out within its own range circle.)

Samsite reveal shroud decreased from 8c0 to 6c0.
(Prevents the RA logic of build an AA in front of your base and all good. You need units/structures to make good use of its range.)

Samsite now fires two shots at a time.
(Increases damage and intuitive to home base of CNC95.)

Recon Bike HP decreased from 120 to 110.
(Takes to long to kill these units when vs minigunners and light vehicle types. APCs taking to long to kill these.)

Airstrip/Weapon Factory power increased from 30 to 50.
(Increased like a disease. Nod players going with an extremely fast 4 strip build without com center. GDI maxing at 3 factories with non stop vehicles. Infantry became to weak.)

Communication Center power increased from 40 to 50.
(See above.)

APC movement speed increased from 128 to 132.
(A little to slow vs light tanks and dealing with buggies. Buggies being faster still they are able to get a few extra shots off. Provides better base entry.)

MRLS range reduced from 12c0 to 11c0.
(Out ranging Nod artillery. Extremely accurate as is and to strong vs several units. Shorter range allows faster vehicles to reach them better.)

MRLS damage vs none reduced from 35 to 25.
(To much damage vs infantry. Specially to e3.)

Obelisk power reduced from 150 to 90.
(Having to build an adv power plant after each Obelisk is put up is insane. Two Obelisk = 180 now and adv power plant is 200.)

Website reference at http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=299238#299238

data.title: More flexible objectives
data.body:
In IRC, people have requested the following feature:

* Allow winning the game by completing any of the primary objectives (currently, you have to complete all of them)

Additionally:
* Hidden objectives that aren't visible in the UI
* 'Decorative' primary objectives that don't influence the outcome of the game when failed

data.title: Work around Open.Nat installation by nuget failing randomly
data.body:
Let's be liberal and just accept both variants. I hope this will finally resolve this for good.

Fixes #12504.

data.title: Open.Nat changed case again
data.body:
thirdparty/fetch-thirdparty-deps.sh was updated because Open.**NAT** had become Open.**Nat** but it seems that it reverted back to Open.**NAT**.

> $ nuget install Open.Nat -Version 2.1.0 -ExcludeVersion
> Installing 'Open.NAT 2.1.0.0'.
> Successfully installed 'Open.NAT 2.1.0.0'.
> $ ls
> Open.**NAT**

data.title: Migrate ProvidesRadar from IDisable to conditions.
data.body: Closes #7037, and restarts our stalled process towards getting rid of `IDisable` for good (#10237).

data.title: Crash (replay attached) in release-20161019
data.body:
While playing online, my game suddenly crashed, however the replay got still saved.
This crash is reproducable amongst all my machines (Debian Linux Sid, mono version unknown, macOS Sierra: 

Michaels-MBP:~ michaelshaulskiy$ mono --version
Mono JIT compiler version 4.8.0 (mono-4.8.0-branch/f5fbc32 Mon Nov 14 14:10:00 EST 2016)
Copyright (C) 2002-2014 Novell, Inc, Xamarin Inc and Contributors. www.mono-project.com
	TLS:           normal
	SIGSEGV:       altstack
	Notification:  kqueue
	Architecture:  x86
	Disabled:      none
	Misc:          softdebug
	LLVM:          yes(3.6.0svn-mono-master/8b1520c)
	GC:            sgen
)

The crash doesn't produce an error message, however I grabbed the source of the release and build it and according to Visual Studio for Mac, a "InvalidOperationException" is thrown in OrderManager.cs at line 58 with the message: Out of Sync in frame 2831. Compare syncreport.log with other players".

This is the stacktrace

 Compare syncreport.log with other players.
  at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.OutOfSync (System.Int32 frame) [0x00038] in /Users/michaelshaulskiy/Desktop/release-20161019/OpenRA.Game/Network/OrderManager.cs:58
  at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.CheckSync (System.Byte[] packet) [0x00048] in /Users/michaelshaulskiy/Desktop/release-20161019/OpenRA.Game/Network/OrderManager.cs:147
  at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager+<TickImmediate>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0 (System.Int32 clientId, System.Byte[] packet) [0x00050] in /Users/michaelshaulskiy/Desktop/release-20161019/OpenRA.Game/Network/OrderManager.cs:114
  at OpenRA.Network.ReplayConnection.Receive (System.Action`2[T1,T2] packetFn) [0x00074] in /Users/michaelshaulskiy/Desktop/release-20161019/OpenRA.Game/Network/ReplayConnection.cs:145
  at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.TickImmediate () [0x000c0] in /Users/michaelshaulskiy/Desktop/release-20161019/OpenRA.Game/Network/OrderManager.cs:107
  at OpenRA.Sync+<CheckSyncUnchanged>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0 () [0x00007] in /Users/michaelshaulskiy/Desktop/release-20161019/OpenRA.Game/Sync.cs:166
  at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[T] (OpenRA.World world, System.Func`1[TResult] fn) [0x00044] in /Users/michaelshaulskiy/Desktop/release-20161019/OpenRA.Game/Sync.cs:183
  at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged (OpenRA.World world, System.Action fn) [0x0001b] in /Users/michaelshaulskiy/Desktop/release-20161019/OpenRA.Game/Sync.cs:166
  at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x0012c] in /Users/michaelshaulskiy/Desktop/release-20161019/OpenRA.Game/Game.cs:532
  at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick () [0x00055] in /Users/michaelshaulskiy/Desktop/release-20161019/OpenRA.Game/Game.cs:585

Attached below, you'll find the replay that causes the crash as well as the syncreport.log (however, that might not be of much use because I don't have the log of the other player)

data.title: Add HiDPI support for OSX/Windows/Linux
data.body: There are three parts to this PR: * Disabling the OS-provided legacy pixel doubling by adding `SDL_WINDOW_ALLOW_HIGHDPI` to the window creation flags. * Detecting DPI changes when switching between high and low resolution displays and recalculating scissor bounds and font glyphs. This depends on SDL 2.0.4, which I have packaged in updated versions of [OpenRALauncherOSX](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRALauncherOSX/releases/tag/osx-launcher-20161223) and [SDL2-CS](https://github.com/OpenRA/SDL2-CS/releases/tag/20161223). A future PR could, in principle, add additional hooks to switch between `@1x` and `@2x` UI artwork too. * Adding a scale factor to decouple font glyph sizes from system point sizes. The main goal here is the massive improvement in text quality, but this also gives us full detail rendering of the half-zoom state in the editor and takes some baby steps towards #10382. ~~Enabling HiDPI under windows requires P/Invoking a native Win32 API (not sure why SDL2 doesn't do this), and Linux is a giant clusterfuck, so this PR is strictly limited to OSX.~~ Before (click for full resolution): After (click for full resolution):
